resource.name: MySQL InnoDB Adaptive Hash Index Memory
MySQL InnoDB Adaptive Hash Index Searches

trigger.name: Binary Log is disabled
trigger.description: Binary Log is disabled. This prohibits you to do Point in Time Recovery (PiTR).

trigger.name: Binlog Cache size too small
trigger.description: Binlog Cache size is possibly to small. A value of 1 Mbyte or higher is OK.

trigger.name: Binlog Statement Cache size too small
trigger.description: Binlog Statement Cache size is possibly to small. A value of 1 Mbyte or higher is typically OK.

trigger.name: Binlog Transaction Cache size too small
trigger.description: Binlog Transaction Cache size is possibly to small. A value of 1 Mbyte or higher is typically OK.

trigger.name: Default Storage Engine is not InnoDB
trigger.description: Your Default Storage Engine is not set to InnoDB.

trigger.name: General Log is enabled
trigger.description: Your General Log is enabled. If this is a production Server under high load, this is not recommended.

trigger.name: InnoDB Buffer Pool Instances is too small
trigger.description: If you are using MySQL 5.5 and higher you should use several InnoDB Buffer Pool Instances for performance reasons. Some rules are: InnoDB Buffer Pool Instance should be at least 1 Gbyte in size. InnoDB Buffer Pool Instances you can set equal to the number of cores of your machine.

trigger.name: InnoDB Flush Log at Transaction Commit
trigger.description: InnoDB Flush Log at Transaction Commit is set to a values != 1. This can lead to a loss of commited transactions in case of a power failure.

trigger.name: InnoDB Force Recovery is enabled
trigger.description: InnoDB Force Recovery is enabled. This mode should be used for data recovery purposes only. It prohibits writing to the data.

trigger.name: InnoDB Log File size is too small
trigger.description: The InnoDB Log File size is possibly too small. Choosing a small InnoDB Log File size can have significant performance impacts.

trigger.name: InnoDB Plugin is enabled
trigger.description: InnoDB Plugin is enabled

trigger.name: IO thread stopped
trigger.description: IO thread has stopped. This is usually because it cannot connect to the Master any more.

trigger.name: IO thread stopped
trigger.description: IO thread has stopped. This is usually because it cannot connect to the Master any more.

trigger.name: Log Output is other than File
trigger.description: Your Log Output is not File. It can lead to problems when you run to Table for too long time.

trigger.name: Log Queries not using Indexes is disabled
trigger.description: You have not enabled log_queries_not_using_indexes. This could help you finding slow queries.

trigger.name: MySQL is down
trigger.description: MySQL database is down. This requires immediate action!

trigger.name: Old Binlog Format is still used
trigger.description: Old (and default) Binlog Format is STATEMENT (SBR). This can lead to inconsistent data in your replication. It is recommended to use Row Based Replication (SBR). This is possible from MySQL v5.1 and newer.

trigger.name: Open files high
trigger.description: Open files is high. Please consider increasing open_files_limit.

trigger.name: Read buffer size is bigger than max. allowed packet size
trigger.description: Read buffer size (read_buffer_size) is bigger than max. allowed packet size (max_allowed_packet). This can break your replication.

trigger.name: Slave errors are skipped!
trigger.description: Slave errors are skipped! This leads to data inconsistency!

trigger.name: Slave is NOT read only
trigger.description: Slave is NOT set to read only. You can accidentally manipulate data on the slave and get inconsistencies...

trigger.name: Slave lagging behind Master
trigger.description: Slave is lagging behind Master. Please check if Slave threads are running and if there are some performance issues!

trigger.name: Slave lagging behind Master
trigger.description: Slave is lagging behind Master. Please check if Slave threads are running and if there are some performance issues! But only while we do not backup... Do not check from 04:00 - 12:00

trigger.name: Sort buffer possibly missconfigured
trigger.description: Sort buffer size is either too big or too small. A good value for sort_buffer_size is between 256k and 4M.

trigger.name: SQL thread stopped
trigger.description: SQL thread has stopped. This is usually because it cannot apply a SQL statement received from the master.

trigger.name: SQL thread stopped
trigger.description: SQL thread has stopped. This is usually because it cannot apply a SQL statement received from the master.

trigger.name: Sync Binlog is enabled
trigger.description: Sync Binlog is enabled. This leads to higher data security but on the cost of write performance.

trigger.name: Table definition cache too small
trigger.description: Your Table Definition Cache is possibly too small. If it is much too small this can have significant performance impacts!

trigger.name: Table open cache too small
trigger.description: Your Table Open Cache is possibly too small (old name Table Cache). If it is much too small this can have significant performance impacts!

trigger.name: Thread stack size is possibly too small
trigger.description: Thread stack size is possibly too small. This can cause problems when you use Stored Language constructs for example. A typical is 256k for thread_stack_size.

trigger.name: Thread stack size is too small
trigger.description: Thread stack size is too small. This can cause problems when you use Stored Language constructs for example. A typical is 256k for thread_stack_size.

trigger.name: Transaction isolation level is set to non-default value
trigger.description: You transaction isolation level is set to an non-default value. Please consider its impacts.

trigger.name: Transaction isolation level is set to non-recommended value
trigger.description: You transaction isolation level is set to an non-recommende value. Please consider its impacts.

trigger.name: Used more than 80% of max connections limited

graph.name: MySQL InnoDB Adaptive Hash Index Memory
MySQL InnoDB Adaptive Hash Index Searches
MySQL Query cache low memory prunes
